text: Alcohol - induced regulation of nuclear regulatory factor-kappa beta in human monocytes .
Acute ethanol exposure has the capacity to modulate immune functions , particularly , to down regulate monocyte production of inflammatory cytokines .
However , the intracellular mechanisms for these effects of ethanol are yet to be understood .

Considering that nuclear regulatory factor-kappa beta ( NF-kappa B ) / Rel is a common regulatory element of the promoter region of the inflammatory cytokine genes , herein , we tested the hypothesis that acute ethanol affects NF-kappa B activation in human monocytes .
Adherence-isolated monocytes showed constitutive DNA binding activity of NF-kappa B .

A clinically relevant dose ( 25 mM ) of acute ethanol treatment in vitro increased NF-kappa B binding activity in monocytes with a preferential induction of the inhibitory , <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , NF-kappa B / Rel homodimer , and resulted in no induction of the <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> heterodimer .

In contrast , lipopolysaccharide stimulation primarily induced the <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> heterodimer that has been shown to result in gene activation .

text: Thus , such unique activation of the inhibitory <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> homodimer by acute ethanol treatment may result in inhibition rather than activation of NF-kappa B - regulated inflammatory cytokine genes .

Consequently , these results suggest that physiologically relevant concentrations of ethanol may affect production of inflammatory cytokines , such as <extra_id_0> tumor necrosis factor-alpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> interleukin-6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> by disrupting NF-kappa B signaling in monocytes .
